intro: Stenoloma tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leafed stenoloma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
